newsitem.title: USA: US FCC sets hearing on MobileMedia filing.
newsitem.headline: US FCC sets hearing on MobileMedia filing.

text.p: The Federal Communications Commission said Tuesday it had ordered a hearing into the qualifications of MobileMedia Corp. to remain a licensee after the company said it had filed false information with the agency.
It said the administrative hearing would give the firm an opportunity to provide mitigating evidence of its ability to deal truthfully with the commission and to abide by FCC rules in the future.

The FCC noted that MobileMedia voluntarily disclosed that if filed false information for paging license applications, but that consistent with past practice, it would be able to operate pending the hearing.

An administrative law judge is to develop the facts and to recommend a decision within six months on whether MobileMedia engaged in misrepresentations, lacked candor and wilfully or repeatedly violated the commissions's rules, the agency said.
